There are a lot of interesting things hanging from the walls and ceilings. nice place to just hang out with friends or get a beer, not too far from Southside works for a $5 burger and a $5 movie on a Monday night.

iY5yEAsVgdEcYvo3k6-GQA.text: We came here last night to spend our Groupon.  We found a table right away at 7pm on a Friday.  You could definitely tell the bar was truly a place for the biking community.  They go beyond just having "bike decor," this is a place for enthusiasts to meet.  There were perhaps 8-10 bikes parked outside on a freezing January day, if that says anything!  We started with beer - I asked for anything like a wheat beer, which the server said they did not have on tap.  Then I asked for whatever their lightest brew might be, which she reported was Oskar Blues Dale Pale Ale (I think beer changes seasonally).  When I got the beer, I was disappointed that it was their lightest selection out of at least six drafts.  It was certainly brown in color, not the golden yellow that signifies the beers I prefer.  My boyfriend got the same beer and really enjoyed it - I thought it was okay, but too hoppy for my taste.  Seems like it might be nice if they had a little more variety in their draft selections - anything light for people like me?  Our table was right next to the jukebox, but we were still able to hear each other over the music.  There was a steady flow of individuals choosing rock songs throughout the night, and TVs situated around the room.  The lights were very dim and I did strain a bit to read the menu (apparently I'm old now), but I ended up settling on the Dirt Rag Delight, while my boyfriend got the Thick Chix.  It didn't take long for our food to arrive.  My burger was cooked to a medium-rare as a requested, and the bun was sturdy and held its shape - not the little soggy things you sometimes get.  My burger came with cheese, peanut butter and pickles, which sounded so bizarre I couldn't resist.  Amazingly, the combination really worked for me.  It's a hilarious sensation, getting peanut butter stuck to the roof of your mouth when you eat a burger.  Out of the two burgers I've had in Pittsburgh, it was my favorite, but I'd say it was just "pretty good" as opposed to "great."  And I had asked for bacon which did not come on the burger, sadly.  The server reported she had put the order in with bacon and the kitchen just messed up.  I believe her, but it was still a bummer - but the burger was fine without it so I asked her not to bother getting some.  My boyfriend, on the other hand, was less wowed by his chicken sandwich.  It sounded incredibly flavorful - chicken with barbecue sauce, onion rings, bacon - how could that not be a major party in your mouth?  When he and I traded sandwiches, I was really floored...with disappointment.  I kid not, somehow it was bland.  Bland!  I can't figure it out!  I think they might've just needed more of everything - there wasn't a whole lot of "stuff" between the buns.  It was supremely underwhelming.  Fortunately the fries were hot, thick, and crispy (but in need of salt).  I had to take some of my burger home, but my boyfriend begrudgingly ate his sandwich, too hungry not to do so.  Two beers and the two sandwiches came to about $24.  Reasonable prices on everything - especially the beer - but it seems like the food, in our case, was hit or miss.  Boyfriend wants to give them another chance, since he liked the atmosphere and he thought it'd be fun to ride our bikes down here sometime.  In spring, presumably.  I'd be okay with that, and I bet if I have been biking a few miles, I'll be so hungry that I won't care if some of the food is good, some is okay, and some is not-so-good.  I'll just need fuel.  And OTB can definitely provide that.

euVSPg4iSk2rALJu3pDYKw.text: Tuesday is awesome at OTB! $2 Corona & $1 tacos = woohoo. Just be prepared for LOUD and omni-present televisions. It's less of a cafe than it is a bike themed sports bar.

o3yRkZj8E2pDRFsN8PAfaw.text: I really enjoy coming here. I've never been here just to drink so I can't say much for the southside weekend night atmosphere. But for dinner I've had a great time. They always seem to have specials going on. Monday night is burger night where any burger is 5 dollars. They also have dollar taco and sloppy joe nights during the week. Pair that up with happy hour specials and $3 Great Lakes and Troegs bottles on certain days.  I went in last night and was able to find a seat despite the back room being reserved for a private party. We started off with the zucchini wrapped in cheese and then baked and served with marinara. It was nice to have something that wasn't fried. The only thing I would say would be for almost $8 to only see 4 bite size wedges I was a little disappointed. I would love to see an extra one on there so each one wasn't about 2 dollars each. I ordered a burger with Sriracha ranch, spinach red peppers and tomatoes. I love this burger and the fries are delicious! They are crispy and so so good! My boyfriend ordered the burger with BBQ sauce and onion rings.  OTB is a great place to get a bite to eat. With all the specials throughout the week there's no reason to not try something simple and delicious before you head to East Carson for a night out.

6pww7CPcWl392SwLdVvn2w.text: Tofu Taco were amazing! Great place for a light lunch while biking.

CA8qNsGWtyXjYrPCQwUm9A.text: This is the coolest decorated bar! They really take the bicycle theme seriously. It's over-the-top, but in a good way! The drinks were priced well, they had tons of specials for every day of the week. I'm definitely going back again! With my bike :)

aPi93vKNNQSXyTGVFKWSQw.text: I'm amending my rating after my latest visit to OTB. It was open mic night, and the bar was hopping, though I wouldn't have called it overly busy by any means...it was only 9 o'clock. The pissed-off bartender didn't exactly make our visit pleasant. He was short with us and seemed entirely unconcerned with providing good service. When my husband went to the bar to ask for a menu he just pointed to the corner where the stack of menus sat, which turned me off right away. He seemed to be the only one actually working the front, so I can excuse SOME of his poor attitude, but not all. The food came and it was ok. We paid, not much of a thank you or have a nice night from the bartender once again. So yeah, we might give this place another chance in the future, but it's not on my must list.

hdT4kabmY-TaxmMc3PMg1w.text: Great beer selection and the food is always good. Surprisingly good ahi tuna!

n3VUeRibBs65TI4plA_Ksw.text: we really loved this place. Popped in on a saturday for lunch - pretty empty. Loved the decor and the staff was friendly (I see in other reviews this has been an issue). I ordered a pannini sandwich with mozzarella, basil and tomato and got the onion rings. all excellent - especially the onion rings. Husband ordered a burger - forget which one - but he said it was excellent. We were bother really happy with the meal and will head back again.

xW9lk_VequDqLVsWcL1dxw.text: Atmosphere - a bar for bicyclers with bikes hanging all over and arty photographs of Pittsburgh and/or bicycles or both some for sale. On walking in I thought we'd made a mistake on seeing the very small bar with a couple tables then walked up a couple stairs in the back to a room with 10-12 tables. Mid-Sunday afternoon there were a couple beer drinkers and as we left a Triathlon group of 10-15 came for a meeting.  Service - surprisingly excellent for a bar considering we were the only ones eating at the time and brought 2 kids with us. Kids were offered coloring books and a selection of markers. One small topping mistake with a burger was quickly remedied and even the chef/cook apologized in passing which was exceptionally nice.  Food - the menu is fun with wild mixes of toppings (peanut butter bacon burger, burger on a salad) that looked fun to try. The kids' meals (usually 2.99) were actually free (Sunday special) and there are a few typical offerings that come with fries, applesauce or celery/carrots.   Burger 1 - Primanti style with egg, cole slaw, fries - was a strong good. 3 stars  Burger 2 - Veggie (all burgers can be made turkey or veggie) boca-style dipped in hot sauce with hot pepper cheese, bacon (yes!), lettuce, tomatoe, blue cheese dressing on side. Delicious. Bun was soft yet not too squishy.   Onion rings - can choose for .95 extra instead of sides. Delicious beer batter, perfectly cooked real onions inside, generous serving. Could have used a little more salt in batter but forgiven because tasted homemade instead of an oversalted mix.  Pretzel appetizer - yummy, typical baked not fried, served with a yummy cheese that seemed like a real cheese spread made with butter instead of plastic nacho cheese. If so quite surprising.  One surprise is that most of the choices on the menu were not very healthy for what you'd think would be a healthy-eating bicycling crowd. Maybe if you triathlon then you don't need to watch what you're eating. The salads were few and very simple. More thought went into the burgers and the sandwiches. There were a a couple simple vegetarian with cheese paninis and the veg burger options and the seitan wings that we didn't try.  Overall primarily a bar with fun and pretty good sandwiches and burger and a couple salads. I'd return for fabulous happy hours and daily specials. $5 burger night for example. $10 any sandwich and a beer night.

QZ5t0RIZ8uDnnv3JJ5O5ww.text: Lots of vegetarian options. Staff is nice. Women's bathroom could be cleaner.

o7j2DSICDkTlhxCsSOwLOg.text: This place is decent.  Bike-themed insides.  The decor didn't overwhelm me with awesomeness and I am not sure I'll be dying to go back any time soon, but the food was great. I had a burger with Black & Tan onion rings, and we had the hummus to start.  All very good, and good specials on beers, of which there is a good variety, during Happy Hour.

7pKqhIOrElXWHsbdGpyKqg.text: STAY AWAY! My fiance and I were going to have lunch here until an employee rudely threw open and hit my fiance with the door. The employee never apologized or even acknowledged hitting my fiance. Would not ever recommend giving your money to this company.

lGiOOz_p6sRIOH5jNzbqrQ.text: This is a super fun bar for a few reasons. The first reason is the decor is all bike related. The second is the ahmaaazing food. And the third is their selection of weird beers. A lot of bars in the southside are a bit typical and boring and I never like the people who go, but this just not the case here!   I have been here a few times, and went back again last night for a little Mother's Day snack. We had two orders of the seitan wings with bbq+ranch and buffalo+bleu. Both come with celery, carrots and soft pita. Perfect amount for sharing (or hoarding). We also shared the spinach dip. It came with more pita and was surprisingly a bit spicy.   Although by this time I was a bit full, I decided to get the veggie burger with fries. I couldn't really tell if the burger was homemade but I also don't know if I cared because it hit the spot. A very traditional burger with lettuce, tomato, onion, cheese and pickles. It was big and a bit hard to fit in my mouth but it all worked out in the end. The fries were my absolute favorite though. Such a crunchy, salty, fried delight. I could not stop eating them.   Definitely returning for more!!

photos.caption: Photo of OTB Bicycle Café - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

2ngpB96XIIccp0rWMpr7JQ.text: So, I went to this biker bar....and by biker I mean bicycle. There is bike parking out front btw!  I really loved the creative burger selections and will absolutely  go back to try a few more!  If you could see the adorable cook dancing in the kitchen while he made our food you could totally see that is made with love!  Each burger is named after some biking thing or place but what I thought was cool was the bike tire wall and the gears in the table and art work.  I'm giving the restaurant a 3 only because the waitress hated us. Which was crazy because we ordered a table full of apps and 7 dishes. Left a big tip even with her bad attitude.

photos.caption: Photo of OTB Bicycle Café - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

YxJwDMuPLuN4-lUoDPoWyg.text: The Dirt Rag Burger is my absolute favorite. Hands down. It comes with cheese pickles and homemade Wholey's peanut butter. I've had a burger similar to his other places and they just can't touch OTB.  My second favorite is Heaven on Earth with mozzarella, roasted red peppers, sauteed spinach. We like bringing out of town guests here for a bite because of the atmosphere and the food. Some of the best burgers in the city.

photos.caption: Photo of OTB Bicycle Café - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. The Hard Tail and Dirt Rag Burgers.
Photo of OTB Bicycle Café - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Menu.
Photo of OTB Bicycle Café - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Interior.

CFhplBM9O1PCfuPP1ww_UQ.text: I checked out this place for the first time the other day with a good friend. First off, upon entry....I LOVED the music. Any time I step into a place and they are playing "Umi Says" by Mos Def, I feel like I am HOME! Singing, "Umi said shine your light on the world. Shine your light for the world to see..." The vibe is very cool and hipster. We sat in the back upper level and it was a bit smoky from the grill, but tolerable. It smelled like I was at a cookout. I hard a hard time figuring out what I wanted. But I love trying out different beers, and they have a nice variety of interesting beers. I had the Crimson Hibiscus that was recommended by the waitress.   My friend had the Soup of the Day, Spicy Chicken Noodle and Tortilla and Grilled Cheese. She did not complain, and it looked good. I finally decided on the 650 Bean Cakes. Ok so at first bite, I was a little taken back by the flavor. It was a little bit charred. But just on the edge of one of the bean cakes. It came with guac, sour cream, and pico de gallo. Once I incorporated that in to the mix, it worked and I enjoyed it. But then I just got tired of eating it. I don't think I will order that again. However, I kept seeing all of these HUGE burgers passing me by, so I am definitely going to give the spot another try, and order one of the burgers.  *still singing* "I aint no perfect man. I'm trying to do the best, that I can with what it is I have."

photos.caption: Photo of OTB Bicycle Café - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. 650 Bean Cakes

ze5P95I-eZxN93wAuUwDdw.text: I love the theme (I love cycling) The burger was top notch and I got the hops to come with  The onion rings are sweet but  The fries are amazing!

uUGE38MpXN_yKrxX0Ok6Bg.text: If you want to enjoy sitting by an looking out on North Park Lake, this is a nice place to do it.  If you want good food at a reasonable price this is not the place to do it.  I have been there 4 times this spring and summer and not one time has my food selection--or that of my companions--has been good.  The most popular hamburgers are tasteless: bun is cold, meat over cooked even though ordered 'medium'. Almost without exception the concocted sandwiches with the cute names are just bad.  Their home made 'signatiure' Potato chips are terrible.  They do not even compare with store bought.  Honestly, I cannot say we found one really good dish.  The OTB Cafe is way overrated even at 3 stars that is why'd I am assigning 2.

hMl_eTGyMIBSm_baU_QNfw.text: I have had nothing but good things to say on my past visits here. Food and service is still good. However I would not recommend having lunch here if you have limited time. The cooks are not in the same hurry as you.

rIlc2DBXa3IL1ilwrMiIFA.text: We have been here a total of 3 times now. Once before just to meet up for beer with friends and twice to eat.   We had found out there was Seitan on the menu and went to try it out. The first time we had some kind of wings I think - which were ok. Just ok...a little overdone/dry but an option for Vegans.   Also, the waitress didn't know they had seitan so I had to really push her to ask about it to get it.   The second time we ate there was a Vegan "McRib" on made of seitan. Totally NOT health food but really, for a non-vegan spot, it was good. Saucey, on a bun...and pretty decent texturally.   We sat at the bar and the bartender was a nice fella. We may have had 1 drink or something. Don't order the salad, bagged mixed greens are just not that good anywhere, or here.   Try it out! Definitely a cool spot to dip in for a snack and a beer - and now Vegans can enjoy it too. I'd call ahead to see if there is a vegan option on the menu before you go if that's why you're going, just in case.

YNYQQ7a3eU3Ht_bEhPBeIA.text: Pros: *Really cool little bicycle-themed joint *Chicken fenders were really tasty and had a kicky Buffalo sauce *Staff is very helpful and friendly *Huge selection of beers *Great happy hour - $2 off select drafts and 1/2 priced apps *Delicious warm pretzels from The Pretzel Shop  Cons: *Hummus had no flavor other than chickpeas. Needs kicked up. *Cheese dip for pretzels tasted like the cheese from mac and cheese but not really in a good way - would have preferred a creamy beer-cheese sauce but that could just be us

gv6mk9K529OvNnrsP040zw.text: Great menu, great sandwiches, incredible trivia night.

Z_GCxQ2B2hYfhuMHedY10Q.text: I've always been a big fan of this place from day one! I decided to stop in after a day of ridding and it was burger night so of corse I had to pick up THE THICK! It was happy hour so two bucks off the draft list I picked up the blockhouse pumpkin. It was awesome and the pumpkin was very mild not over powering for a seasonal style. The burger was fantastic I love the Black and Tan rings on it! One thing that I can say that I don't like that is misleading is "the bmx" burger because it says "mac and cheese" and there's not mac and cheese on it. Next the server only came over after I was finished with my food to ask how is everything. Over all I'll definitely be returning but I think a few things need fixed.

photos.caption: Photo of OTB Bicycle Café - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of OTB Bicycle Café - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of OTB Bicycle Café - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

WLrTVTUhIWMFAZrVFG3hLA.text: I ordered food To-Go from here, a Heaven on Earth burger with a veggie patty, and fries. The burger had winter spinach, fresh buffalo mozzarella, tomato and some AMAZING roasted red peppers. The burger itself was a frozen veg patty, but the siracha mayo, alone with the cooked veggies, really balanced out the dryness of the burger. The patty was also grilled, which added a nice crunchy element to the dish. The fries were  battered and seasoned perfectly. I will definitely eat here again because I'm dying to try their seitan wings. I've heard that they are pretty good. I'm glad that they have a decent amount of vegetarian options.

KMzvYuarj5DtvcNhu1B3Ug.text: Problem is moreso with Postmates, but if OTB is going to use Postmates you should have an accurate menu on their site.  Was trying to get some grilled cheese and tomato soup because that's an obvious pairing and OTB has great grilled cheese, so I was thrilled when I saw The Tandem on the menu, and I quote "A traditional grilled cheese sandwich pressed between  Breadworks Sour Dough and served with a cup of our  homemade tomato soup. What a pair!" so I ordered two of those for myself and my partner.  When it arrived there was no soup, just the sandwich and coleslaw.   The grilled cheese and coleslaw were great, but I absolutely would not have ordered if I knew the tomato soup didn't come with it. I ended up placing a separate order from Ten Penny for soup because somehow they were the only restaurant in the city with deliverable tomato soup last night. Looking at the menu on OTB's site now I only see the tandem as a kid's item, and it doesn't come with soup, and it costs less than the menu item on Postmates, which is not listed as a kid's item.  What's the point of partnering with Postmates if the menu isn't accurate and you get charged for items you don't get? Attached images are from Postmates showing the discrepancy.

photos.caption: Photo of OTB Bicycle Café - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Adult Tandem description on Postmates; doesn&#39;t actually come with tomato soup, charged for it and would not have ordered had I known.
Photo of OTB Bicycle Café - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Adult Tandem available on Postmates. Not an actual menu item apparently.

19_Ph7oqFXBv2vx_D7v0xQ.text: Let me start with this: The service and appetizers are so good...  ..but I really felt compelled to write this review because of the disappointing veggie burger I had last night.  You can dress up a Morningstar veggie patty, but it still has that distinct taste. If you know anything about veggie burgers, you will know that's not necessarily a good thing. You know who else sells Morningstar patties? Burger King. Despite all of the fixings, I felt like I was eating a $10 Burger King burger.  If you make your own bean cakes, why can't you make your own patties? Or find a better frozen patty?

m0NGMd-hVhQZD54doWM6mg.text: I have been a fan of OTB - they have decent bar food and good wraps. A nice beer list with $2 off happy hour draft beer!  Great biking place with plenty of bike parking out front and during the summer they have outdoor seating. Years ago we hosted an event there and they were good to work with for our party. Good stop in the Southside!

photos.caption: Photo of OTB Bicycle Café - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. The BLT panini!

MC-dlmyr35OhmvLwC3lbVw.text: We went to the Bicycle Cafe a little after lunch this past weekend and we loved it! It's has a great atmosphere and the staff were so friendly! Service was great and the food was awesome! We'll definitely be coming back.

b3-7IeXL5UER_h5emfOFFA.text: Newly vegan here! So as it were I have a heightened awareness of when restaurants print that tiny little "v" next to each dish. I am happy to report that there are at least 7 vegetarian options at OTB Bicycle Cafe.  I had the seitan wings,  little wheat protein nuggets  crunchy on the outside and soft and juicy on the inside they were covered in Sweet Baby Rays bbq sauce. They were excellent and my meat eating boyfriend agreed that they were super tasty.   I wasn't a fan of the hummus. The hummas was sweet like a cloying

photos.caption: Photo of OTB Bicycle Café - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. barbecue seitan wings, hummus, chicken and waffles

9UWLRbNhZIHMsgQXYkJMZA.text: Got a great Bicycle Times BLT here! Comes with avocado and egg. There were a lot of different options and they have vegetarian dishes as well. For the BLT, you can have fries, the house salad, or a corn bean salad. I believe there is an upcharge for the salad, which is $1. You can also get onion rings for an upcharge.   When you walk in, it is kind of confusing because the bar is in front and the restaurant area is in the back but there is no sign telling you to choose your own seat to make sure you guys don't awkwardly stand there...which is what we did while we tried to figure it out.   Overall service was good and our waitress was very friendly. I definitely recommend coming here with a group of friends because it's a fun restaurant environment.

photos.caption: Photo of OTB Bicycle Café - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Bicycle times BLT

4rv2BBASV74QsHc34iDFyA.text: I find this place pretty overhyped. They do one, maybe two things right: the Dirt Bag burger with peanut butter and maybe beer. Otherwise the food is boring, flavorless, and honestly lacks originality. Even the paleo menu for some reason is all Mediterranean, as if that's the only flavor that works with paleo food. I've been here so many times but finally today I've decided I won't be back.

-1S5FtSCGj6vL-6oZs8vlA.text: Went here with my girlfriend after walking to the Zenith Tea Garden and realizing it was closed for a private party. The atmosphere inside of the bar is much better than most of the places found in the Southside. When you don't belong to the popped collar crowd of bar hoppers it's often hard to find a bar you can relax inside of in that area of Pittsburgh. OTB has some great "bar food" that is also healthy, most of the sandwiches and salads had the option of substituting seitan with chicken which is very appealing to vegetarians and health minded bar goers. I had the Rail Trail Wrap which was chicken, lettuce, carrots, and provolone cheese inside of a pita. The chicken was tossed in a perfect amount of Buffalo sauce (so many places put way too much to the point where all you can taste is the sauce) and the pita was warm, fluffy, and chewy. I ordered onion rings but the chef mistakenly made french fries. I'm a pretty "live and let live" guy so I let it go but the waitress offered to make a batch for free. I declined; fries are slightly healthier than onion rings, and it wasn't a big deal. The fact that she caught the mistake and offered to correct it was all I needed to remain happy. My girlfriend got tomato soup and a mozzarella, red pepper, and tomato panini. I am not a fan of tomato soup but I tried a spoonful and thought it was really good. It didn't taste canned and you could see small amounts of the tomato which leaves me to believe that it was homemade; needless to say, it was delicious, as was the sandwich she had. OTB is a great little bar that isn't just for bike enthusiasts. But at the end of a bike ride it'd be great to grab a beer there and eat a healthy lunch while watching one of their two big plasma screens. I have a review of a second experience here: eatinginpittsburgh.com/2...

TuELyyfOtmwaqxJIMkb6UA.text: Best burger I've had in Pittsburgh.  Each bite gave me a mouth orgasm.    The only thing I was not a fan of was the menu.  It was really hard to navigate thru due to the name not telling you what the food was and the SUPER long description for the name.  Then somewhere in that paragraph you get a description of the item.  Also, if you have kids I wouldn't recomend bringing them here or if you're hungover.  This is a dive bar and reeks of alcohol.  If you're hungover your stomach will be churning from memories of those shots you took the night before.  Check out the weekly specials where you can get those scrumptions burgers for $5!  Additionally, they  have vegan/vegetarian options.  My girlfriend wasn't a huge fan of the vegan burger she ordered but is willing to try another option on the menu again.

ev3OQph9WEcjMgQBWQcplA.text: Please yelpers stop with the references to PBR and hipsters when you review this place. I really don't care if a guy wants to wear skinny jeans cover himself in tattoos and grow a beard to his toes, to each their own. Not every bicycle lover is a "hipster" bicycle lovers were around long before that term existed.  I have tried this place twice, first time I have to say it was fine, service was decent and the food just ok. Nothing amazing on the menu but enough to satisfy, I wish there were more vegetarian options that included more than portabella mushrooms as their main ingredient but oh well.  The beer is ok some local craft beers but its 5$ for most of them there are a few 3$ options, that price is ok but there beer glasses are medium not large.  Like I said my first visit was fine, but the second one was a different story all I can chalk it up is that they have more business now and from a management standpoint are disorganized and not keeping up with demand.  Which is sad because this could be a super cool little joint, here's what is standing in the way.  1. Splurge for a beer or drink menu so we know wtf we are ordering, the scribbles on the back of the waitresses pad doesn't count.  2. Hire at least one more food server, who is not a bartender and one more cook for the kitchen. We got there on a Saturday just shy of 2 hrs past opening hour (12pm) Placed an order for two sandwiches, we never saw our sandwiches. Yet people all around us even some who sat down after got their food and left in that time. I can only attribute that to two options 1, the cook forgot our order, or 2 our waitress forgot to place it. Either way get on top of your staff or get rid of them if they cannot keep up on a busy lunch hour, lunch should never take 1 hour + to serve.   3. If your service sucks try a sincere sorry instead of a bunch of superficial ones. Throughout our wait our waitress kept muttering sorry, but offered no solution except they were very busy today...... a place trying to keep business will offer compensation such as free food or at least free drinks. This place did neither all they did was say sorry we are busy, yea so are lots places they don't make you wait an hour for a sandwich an offer no help. I told my friend I thought we should do the right thing and pay for our beers, then the bartender shouted rudely "I can't take your tab here your waitress has it." Thanks add insult to injury, then I was left awkwardly standing in the way of the bar because the place is so tiny there was no place else to stand while we waited for the waitress.... who last chance never offered us our beers for free. That should have been a given with that kind of crap service.   So I was forced to go eat in a chain restaurant with my friend on a Saturday, sad times. Don't think I will be sharing this place with friends any longer, I think its building up the reputation for bad service that Double wide has.

0N5xKbb6egTp_Kf20e_8xg.text: I have been here twice in the past week, and both times the food was good and the service was extremely slow. The venue is fun, especially if you cycle, and there are some really good vegetarian options, but the service is definitely lacking. I had two different waitresses - the first one seemed rushed despite the fact that it was pretty slow and the second was just slow for no apparent reason. However, I love the beer so I will keep coming back! Also, there are some great food specials ($1 tacos on Taco Tuesday, etc.).

52IfnrSfV7THMhOl7wSwAw.text: this place was awesome. especially if your into biking. had the vegetarian wings. good. cheap good beer.

16FuikNrVvfIFpL_hi7u0A.text: I would hardly call this a dive bar. It's a little too nice for that. But it's pretty rad. Sort of wish this establishment was in Philadelphia. I think it'd be a big hit.  This place is, you got it, bike themed! Interesting bikes hang from the ceilings intertwined with christmas lights. Rims decorate the walls. Even old bike parts make up new things in the decor.   I came here on a Sunday night. Not exactly the busiest time, so I have no idea what this place gets like on a weekend. But it was quiet and they have some pretty good beers on draft. The draft beers are a little pricey but the mix drink my friend got was on special. It was in a pretty big glass for only $2.50. I got a Troeg's Mad Elf. Delicious!  I hear they have a good menu with vegetarian options but the kitchen was closed when I went.  The guy working the bar was pretty nice and chatted with us and some other patrons about the show that was on TV and other such things. It was nice and quiet.   There's also a back room with more seating that was closed when we were there.   I can really see this being a pretty rad place. I want to come back when I can get the full experience.

4xjAGWpsGaX5N104B6ICJQ.text: I've been meaning to try this place, and what intrigued me the most was all of the vegetarian options I scoped out on their menu.  You can get any of their burgers as beef, turkey or veg, and they have other vegetarian sandwich options as well.  I ended up wussing out when ordering and played it safe with a mozzarella/tomato/red pepper panini and onion rings.  The bread was toasty, buttery and fantastic (they serve breadworks bread) but the filling was kind of meh.  Fairly boring and flavorless.  I did thoroughly enjoy the battered onion rings though.  The hubby got a well done burger and onion rings, and the burger came out cooked perfectly.  The staff was friendly, but our waitress was a bit forgetful and very distracted by the Pens game.  Overall it wasn't bad and I would give it another shot.

By0sRQ4uyGcJxTVentwGAw.text: Felt wayyyy out of place hanging out here, being that everyone else there were bicyclists hanging out after a cycle-in-your-underwear charity thing, but it was the first place we came across and it wound up being a fun place to hang out.  Great beer selection, a lot of interesting beers I haven't tried before at pretty good prices.  Had a really good waitress, too.

6Kg0e9--Ohe0Y1I5eb3YBg.text: Food: great selections for lunch or with drinks, many vegetarian options, all burgers can be made vegetarian (try the Fixer with peanut butter and blackberry jam), great seitan wings, many different sandwiches and wraps to choose from  Price: average price, due to the unique menu it feels like you are getting your money's worth, three people ate lunch with appetizer and tip for $40 (no booze)  Drinks: full bar, select few good draft beers, good bottled beer list  Atmosphere: usually a lot of bike scene people who all seem to be friendly, art on the wall to look at or purchase, cool decor, nice TVs at the bar, outdoor seating available, can sit near the bar or in a separate room away from the noise  Service: very friendly and fast, waitresses stop by multiple times to check up on you, filled waters multiple times, provided plenty of condiments and napkins  (+): very friendly service, very vegetarian friendly, fair prices, unique menu, good beer, nice people inside  (-): a little dark (but its a bar), mostly lunch type menu  Would I go back again? Definitely

_eoExT0yW_brqwJWqIqa9g.text: Good vegan options but it'd be great if the veggie burger was vegan too.  The beer didn't disappoint either and we were there during happy hour so they knocked a couple bucks off the beers and appetizers were half price!

fJ4lrDYwWHw7fxwZjkRyrA.text: I got the tofu tacos, my posse got burgers. One burger had an avocado all up in one and the other had a portobello paying rent. I'm trying to describe how smokey and juicy and tasty their burgers were but my mouth is going through phantom tastin's right now. I'm actually kind of depressed as I write this because I won't be in Pittsburgh for a few months which means I can't have a tasty burger from the Bicycle Cafe. If you are in Pittsburgh and CAN go to the Bicycle Cafe then I am seriously casting some serious shade on you right now because that's where I want to be for dinner tonight. Oh and my tofu tacos were good. Lots of guac which I like. And another oh, their sweet tea? Holy smokes, their sweet tea. Probably one of the best glasses of sweet tea I've had. Oh, great. It's almost lunch time and I am in Maryland :(

f56tK86GcHS1R_l4uDedYA.text: Hmm...what to say about this place.  The location was convenient as it was close to Southside Works.  Yea...that is about it.  The service was terrible.  Our waiter looked like a Flock of Seagulls wannabe and had the personality of a doorknob.  We asked for beer suggestions and were a bit snubbed.  It's not like this place offered fancy martinis, so I knew the waiter could offer at least one beer from their draft selection.    The crowd was a bit unique, but seemed to be having a fun time.  There was a live band the night I was there, so had I stayed longer, I may have enjoyed the night a bit more.    It is hard to not judge a place based on one person, but this place gave me no choice.  I will not be making a return trip to this bar.  Ever.

MaQTiAl80G9JIULZVe3GaA.text: Great food, good atmosphere, nice beer selection.  Highly recommend for a casual meal and/or drink!

GiTCwEZB82ZKbbTx_ZDPsQ.text: best fries. lots of vegetarian options. unique burgers. cool decor. friendly waiters/bartenders.

w8SXl3N_o76u5Q0yNMoHhw.text: Stopped in here for a quick beer and a possible bite to eat. We were too late to eat, but I will definately be back to try it out.  I'm a fan of the overall theme.  Quite different from most places in the South Side.

4nvQzpsW9PiQYzNGjfdozQ.text: First trip to Carson since moving to Pittsburgh.  This place caught my eye, but I was weary that it would be a hipster bar experience with nonchalant, less-than-happy-to-serve staff.  Was completely wrong.  Our waitress was super nice, drinks weren't expensive, and the tunes were rockin'.  I felt like a schmuck for my prejudice.  This place even practices what they preach -- a bike corral is out front so you CAN actually bike there. Definitely going back.

zdGSn9ks0pCr4hfrbsL14g.text: Cute borderline-dive bar in Southside.  As the name states, this bar has bicycle paraphernalia everywhere, wheels propped up as a wall, bikes hung on the ceiling.  The crowd was a bit bleek for a Saturday evening but laidback.  There was live music (i.e. one singer with his guitar and computer), and people seemed to enjoy themselves.  Interesting beers on tap (most of them I have never heard of).  A decent place to go with few friends for some drinks and conversations.

a5I5QObpC56MI7HA3oTM1g.text: Found this little nugget on a whim. Enjoyed the food and beer specials. Staff is friendly. Have returned a few times and will continue to frequent.

4j7pSPECvMKymQq0jMwDZw.text: Not a dive bar by far but cute. Some really great bikes hanging esp the Orange richie.$2 pbr. No complaints.

photos.caption: Photo of OTB Bicycle Café - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. not even st patties day.

iPAuc8j9ogHqbedm60nKbg.text: I really like this place! I like their beer choices if you look past the draft list (which is not impressive, to be honest.) Very cool, chill atmosphere. I've also got food several times, and have never once been disappointed. I think the sandwich I get is called the Roadie. The staff are very friendly as well. At times, it's a bit crowded of a joint, but if you go at the right time, this place is stellar.

SKCsw46gkooRJJ8MwuU54g.text: Finally got to try a burger here after years of hearing great things.  It definitely did not disappoint.    For my meal I went with the Wheelmill burger which sounded different than any burger I have ever had.  After the burger is done cooking they dip the whole thing in buffalo sauce.  The burger is then topped with jalapeno cream cheese, bacon, and pico de gallo.  The flavors of the burger were incredible.  The buffalo sauce and jalapeno cream cheese were an amazing combination, and the pico was a great touch to cool things down.  The meat definitely fresh and ground daily.  I ate this burger so fast because of how good it tasted.  My only complaint was the burger was cooked more to a medium well or medium, rather than medium rare.  However, this was not a huge issue because of the great flavors of the toppings and the fresh beef.

photos.caption: Photo of OTB Bicycle Café - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. The Wheel Mill Burger
Photo of OTB Bicycle Café - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. The Wheel Mill Burger

raUY9sZFkG2eh79iLZ4TYA.text: This place was awesome! A couple of my friends and I came here midway through our bike ride around the city. They have bike racks outside and seating, but it was super humid, so we opted for some AC. The decor is fun and bicycle themed.  All 3 of us had burgers, 2 of us had the Wheel Mill (get it, it's so good!!!) and the other had the BMX. My husband was only disappointed in the BMX because he thought it had mac n cheese on it because it said "Bacon Mac eXperiment", but he didn't read the rest of the description. It's their play on a "Big Mac". Either way, once he got over that, he loved it too. The fries were delicious too.  The service was also excellent. Our waitress was super attentive and also offered to refill all of our camelbacks with ice water.  My only complaint is that I ate too much and felt extremely uncomfortable on my bike ride home. Haha. I would definitely come back here again!

v98kivNY5-ScUeK9_P4Jfw.text: I would DEFINITELY recommend OTB to anyone in the Southside area, or otherwise! I go once or twice whenever I visit my sister in Pittsburgh. Their food is super fresh; you can tell that nothing comes out of a freezer. Also, the flavors are so good. I'm definitely not an "American food" restaurant type person (as you can probably see from my reviews lol) but I would go out of my way to get a burger or wrap from this place.   This time, I got the Rail Trail wrap to-go and it was very good! The buffalo sauce adds a nice kick...I think I would have enjoyed it a bit more if the chicken would've been fried and not grilled. (But maybe they offer that as an option! I didn't ask.) I subbed the fries for onion rings...soooo good. Do yourself a favor and always get the onion rings as your side. Also, the spinach dip (which I failed to snag a photo of because I was too busy eating) is a MUST. The dip has just the right amount of both spinach and artichoke, and it's served with pita bread triangles.  See you next time I visit Pittsburgh, OTB!

photos.caption: Photo of OTB Bicycle Café - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Rail Trail Wrap with a couple of bites gone

ckbouuWngtw3QBmaZfoW4g.text: The PBR sandwich & BMX burger are what dreams are made of. The quality & taste is always consistent. Not to mention, the burger & sandwich prices are very reasonable for the quality, taste & portion served. This place also always has a great beer selection (draft or can/bottle). The servers & patrons are typically always talkative & pleasant . Not sure you will find a better chicken sandwich or burger on the SouthSide!

W3IoLYQEKpJ5AvNycKT8YA.text: I think I've been here more than any other spot in Pgh and I'm surprised I haven't reviewed it. I loveeee this place! The service is great and everyone who works here is really nice and friendly. I usually get The Cog Salad with ranch which is just a cute name for a Cobb salad. Cobb salads are my favorite type of salad and I haven't found a place that does them better than OTB. I've also had the Punk Bike Pickles (fried pickles), also delicious. I've had a few of the burgers too and I've never been disappointed. The seitan wings are definitely worth a try, especially on their wing night. They have a "healthy eating menu" with paleo, keto, etc. options, as well. I tried the portobello mushroom sandwich when I was keto and it was surprisingly good!   Lastly, I don't know much about beer/cider but I always manage to find one I like here. I've tried several new ones here both on tap and in bottles/cans.   This is a great south side spot. I could probably eat here everyday

photos.caption: Photo of OTB Bicycle Café - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Sam&#39;s Portabella &#34;Sam&#34;wich
Photo of OTB Bicycle Café - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. The Cog Salad

dA6_SYwSibd0eDnP8CZ2xQ.text: The service, first of all, was great.  Our server was super friendly and made us feel at home. Iron City beer is the best if you're ever in the area. I also tried the arsenal snowbound cider with tasted like Christmas. So good.   I had a panini and my sister had a burger, both were yummy and we also shared an order of the soft pretzels.  Their beer cheese and honey mustard were delicious.   Also the whole style and vibe was awesome.  Friendly people, fine food, good drinks.

photos.caption: Photo of OTB Bicycle Café - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of OTB Bicycle Café - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of OTB Bicycle Café - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

X6MMtp1P6Hiv4c0oZZOeTg.text: Stopped here for lunch on a Saturday with my friend and 2 dogs, because I had heard that the food was good and that they offered dog-friendly sidewalk seating. Both turned out to be True!   I am a bit of a beer snob and was very impressed with their draft list. It included a handful of local breweries, which I was pleased to see.  The healthier options food menu happened to be $2 off during this time so I decided to make the better-for-me choice and order from there. My friend did as well and we were both pleasantly surprised with how good our meals were. As two people who happen to be trying to make healthier eating choices, it was SO nice to be able to eat at a restaurant and not feel guilty about what we were eating or have to struggle with calculating calories or figuring out how things were made. Plus, it was delicious. She ordered the chicken tacos and I had a Moroccan chicken wrap. Satisfying and delicious!   We sat outside because we had the dogs (who were very much welcomed!), but the inside decor was cool and unique. I saw families and couples dining inside, so it is both a bar and restaurant.   Service was great. Prompt, friendly, and helpful in addressing any questions we had about the menu or needs or extra sauce ;)  I look forward to returning here again!

photos.caption: Photo of OTB Bicycle Café - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Chicken Tacos
Photo of OTB Bicycle Café - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Moroccan chicken lettuce wrap and steamed broccoli

RM-pLWSkTr4h-q2pCQGxjw.text: My "panini" was just regular bread pressed together and had almost no flavor, even though I got grilled chicken with it. Also, they put both halves of the sandwich together to serve it, which made the one half of the bread soggy. There are good things on the menu and very mediocre stuff. Just have to make note of which is which. Will not get that item the next time.

M86qsIBpGIL4tDLmhnIlvw.text: I went here the other day for the second time because I remembered how good their burgers were and I wanted to try it again. I ordered the wheel mill burger and it was so good! There was a perfect amount of toppings on it in each bite. The jalapeno cream cheese was so amazing on it. I'm so glad I ordered it! The prices are also very reasonable here and they have a good happy hour!

photos.caption: Photo of OTB Bicycle Café - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

ZVZKHmtEDM4QfD48571MBA.text: I was so excited to find this place because I've been eating Paleo and they actually have a menu without about six items that are all paleo! I've gotten then heaven on the plate which was basically a high quality burger with aioli and veggies and the chicken crust pizza. The name of a the chicken crust pizza was a little misleading, it was basically a chicken breast that was pounded a little bit with bruschetta on the top. However, it was still a good paleo option. My husband got the giant pretzel and it was ok, basic bar food. Definitely worthwhile to check out if you're looking a healthy item menu.

photos.caption: Photo of OTB Bicycle Café - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Heaven on a plate
Photo of OTB Bicycle Café - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Bar area
Photo of OTB Bicycle Café - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Front restaurant area

CtF5Htw5GMKWQIVtfpJvTw.text: Not somewhere I would typically visit and in all honesty I probably won't be back. But my friend wanted to come and he likes the place so I said why not.  We started off with the Stick Shifters, which were pretty good and actually pretty spicy. But then I tried the PBR sandwich. It was grilled chicken, swiss cheese, fried pickles, bacon, tomatoes and ranch. My bun was burnt and in all honesty there was a weird taste to the whole sandwich.  The atmosphere was pretty meh. The tap list wasn't the best either so I just drank water.

9_GQmb50-Dyy7ow5x5jOsw.text: Decided to try this place for lunch for the first time. It was super busy when we went and It took the server a little while to attend to us which was odd since It wasn't busy. Nothing crazy slow though. I ordered a grilled chicken wrap with veggies and fries. Very good and filling. Prices were great! The atmosphere inside was super cool and the bike theme was really neat! Would definitely come back!

0cI6enhrVu-pHhGth-54iA.text: I came to OTB today because I saw in a review that they have a paleo menu, which is so wonderful. I'm doing Whole30 for the month, and realized how few restaurants in Pittsburgh have compliant meals. So, thank you guys for working to include this alternate menu.   Unfortunately the server recommended the lettuce wraps, but I would not order these again. You couldn't pick the wraps up, so it was just like a small salad. It also lacked flavor and I had to add my side salad dressing to it. The side salad was large, simple and the Mediterranean dressing was delicious.   I'd come back to try other things on the paleo menu, but not the lettuce wraps.

photos.caption: Photo of OTB Bicycle Café - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Paleo menu as of April 2018
Photo of OTB Bicycle Café - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Gabe&#39;s Moroccan Chicken Lettuce Wrap / $10.99; 3/5 stars

-soLhqWhzQcry_fdC2UjEQ.text: Really liked this place. Cool atmosphere. They have a little bit of outdoor seating. They had $2 off cans of beer tonight and their beer list is pretty expansive. The service was not great, our waitress was covering a lot of tables and she clearly was stretched pretty thin. I had "The Wheel Mill" burger which was excellent, honestly one of the best burgers I've had in Pittsburgh. The homemade jalapeno cream cheese on it was fantastic. Their fries were very good too as was their ranch dressing. When we got our check, the appetizer we had was 1/2 off which was a nice surprise (happy hour?).

photos.caption: Photo of OTB Bicycle Café - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. The Wheel Mill

xYo5q5ZaG1Qyd3QvFTTbsQ.text: Really good burgers at the OTB. Draft Beer selection is somewhat limited but there's plenty of cans and bottles. The food is very high quality. Burgers are great. If I want a really tasty burger this is my destination in the Southside.

gnzawkFcY1rY-GBEYfcsXA.text: My boyfriend and I ate here while we were doing a Whole30 challenge and had limited dining out options for WH30 compliant meals.  OTB happens to have a dedicated Paleo-friendly menu, which usually translates to Whole30 compliant food if you make the necessary modifications. I got a chicken sandwich and my boyfriend got chicken "pizza". The chicken was prepared well, but I ended up dousing mine in as much olive oil and salt as I could get on it without going overboard because there wasn't a lot of flavor and zero fat to satiate. It was so "meh". The chicken pizza was just okay. Honestly I could probably have overlooked this if the service wasn't so lackluster on top of it.

AI_uRq_NmrvSKL3pvt4iyA.text: (we're behind and this is from a visit in March 2018)  He Said: Thankfully She wrote her review right away, so I'm counting on her for the details.  I definitely remember the people being ultra friendly and the tap list being excellent.  And if a place can serve up good beer and accommodate our group of kids with many tastes all while smiling we will always remember them.    She Said: We were looking for a place for lunch after getting into town, and we needed a place with good beer and beyond-salad vegan options. OTB hit that sweet spot! He and I shared a burger and onion rings, and I'll let him speak to that. The teens each had variations on the burger (one standard, one vegan, and one daily special with popcorn shrimp on it), and they were all quite pleased with their meals. In fact, the youngest was raving about his meal through the night. I snuck a couple of french fries off their plates, and I was impressed with them. Crispy on the outside, and creamy on the inside with good flavor. The beer selection was good, and it was nice to have some local brewery options. (Hat tip to Hitchhiker Brewing--the brewer there does good work.) Our waitress was attentive and nice, the vibe was cool, and we definitely recommend the place.  Potty Points: 2 out of 5. It is what it is. It's not a place where I'll linger in the bathroom, and the ladies' room toilet was oddly low, but it serves its purpose.

BRKZA1S39GbjjnscdpYABw.text: I love coming to OTB! It's in Southside, but a little bit away from the craziness.  Every time I've come I've been able to find a seat without a problem.  OTB is a dive bar with a super fun local bicycle theme.  Everything on the menu is related to bikes in some way, and all of the burgers are named after Pittsburgh cycling institutions/events and teach you something about them as well.  My go to order at OTB is an appetizer of fried pickles and The Bicycle Advocate burger.  The bicycle advocate is a burger topped with American cheese, fries, coleslaw, bacon, and a fried egg....sooo tasty! If you are a vegetarian, this place also seems to have a lot of vegetarian options available as well.  OTB also has a lot of beers on tap and in the can to try.  They usually have one or two beer specials that you can find out about if you ask!  I highly recommend OTB for a great dinner and a drink!

photos.caption: Photo of OTB Bicycle Café - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. BMX burger...topped with special sauce, iceberg lettuce, American cheese, bacon, pickles, and onions! Yum!
Photo of OTB Bicycle Café - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. The bicycle advocate...burger topped with American cheese, bacon, fries, coleslaw, and a fried egg

fcT5AsjH-N-Qpe2NsD09bg.text: OTB is close by, so I'm there at least once a month. Food is great. New drinks are always coming in. Service is on top of everything.  Equally as good of a lunch spot during the day as it is a bar spot at night.

7cE2NYL6hqFoqfEJ2_760w.text: Great atmosphere--newly remodeled. Friendly staff. Great prices. AMAZING bar food. Homemade dressings... the ranch. Oh my wow, the ranch. The fried pickles and the fries! Anyone in search for breaded fries--search no more. Our table ordered 4 sides of fries and we ate all of them. No shame. They're amazing. Just go here.

photos.caption: Photo of OTB Bicycle Café - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

dbJcvmcTu4nAzgkUhC66Ug.text: Food was great - atmosphere wonderful - I like how the bar area and eating area a separate enough.  Fried zucchini wrapped around cheese - so yummy!  Makes the decision easy between getting zucchini or mozzarella sticks - both in one!  Delicious veggie burger with fresh mozz and cooked spinach and red peppers!

0_nv1RRsIfuRJLW2BPXaXA.text: Why doesn't _________ have a bar like this?!  OK, so I really wanted to check out OTB the last time I was is Pittsburgh. The bicycle theme seemed novel, and frankly, I'd never seen a bicycle bar in any other city.  I had very little idea what to expect. Would it be a bunch of hipsters and messengers sitting around drinking PBR in a can? Would I feel out of place because I'm not really part of that culture? It turns out that this is just a really chill bar, with a bicycle theme, and great place to hang out.  The tap list ranges from PBR (and $1 a pint, to boot) to Great Lakes to Bells and a number of other good options. The menu features better-than-typically bar food, and everything is bicycle-theme. I ordered the "rail trail wrap" and my girlfriend had the "tandem". The menu is vegetarian friendly, which was a big deal for some of the people in my group.   I wish my city had a place like this. Don't take it for granted, Pittsburgh!

Rtz6WMPvm1LFlkJOCjAqvw.text: Drove three hours with the intent of solely stopping here, cause why not?  Loved the atmosphere, food is amazing, and the staff is great. Definitely a stop for a foodie or someone who wants something outside of the standard restaurant. Will be back again!

xowOxxmCqde2nzd6bsvEdA.text: The food is not bad at this place but the service was at best adequate. I never received a drink refill. The bartender / waiter never smiled and was very dour perhaps the result of a bad day.  The waitress that took over at the end of our meal was much better. Worth another try. This could be a 3 or 3.5 star review and probably would have Ben if we had that waitress from the start.

4c5KqgSGwV5aniSr0xKXyw.text: Really nice, one of my favorite lunch time spots. Everything on the menu is great and they have a nice microbrew selection. Very friendly bartenders and servers. Can get crowded at night.

vQOAx-opY2seRE2GYntOfA.text: Went there with family while visiting back home. Atmosphere was excellent. Food was great. Our waiter Ray was the best very accommodating and attentive to our needs. We will be back.

2jiP9vYGJS3xusMMGSfy5g.text: Service leaves a lot to be desired. Taco Tuesday is a decent deal.

8P3mf0JpRDYguuMQGEoN8Q.text: Pretty good!  Good beer selection, good food, good atmosphere.  Beer selection is always good, and the bartenders I've talked to actually like beer.  (Not always a given, even in decent bars.)  Food is very solid bar food, too - not just crappy wings and middling burgers.  On my last visit (December '11), I finally got around to trying one of the burgers with peanut butter on it.  Not bad, but it didn't add much, either.  Regardless, I appreciate that they offer twists on the usual bar food.  (...And not just by doing something "wild and crazy" that tastes like crap just as a marketing stunt.)  The bike decor is nice - some of it's pretty ingenious.  Only downside is that it can get a little too hipster, but that's the case with a lot of good bars, so it's not a big deal.

gZ_IYWCMkd2wXfeppm3V0Q.text: OMG. The fried pickles with peanut butter.  .....to die for Excellent burger Gotta go and try it out

LH7U1CyrAXWM3pzkxbWFGw.text: I love this place for a quick lunch. The food is always delicious and the bartenders are friendly and attentive.

eO-vm1LPOBp5LWjU14-UGQ.text: Good burgers and salad. Amazing fries. Great healthy choices on menu. I usually get the cog salad. Service is kind of slow though.

dDiRXH8oSNzAmGeJQAVcOw.text: This is getting 5 stars for their peanut butter burger alone. I can't speak to the rest of the menu, but as an avid peanut butter lover, I was psyched to get this much-talked about treat. It was the best burger I've ever had. Maybe I'm biased because I would bathe myself in anything and all things peanut butter, but the meat was cooked perfectly and the peanut butter melted slowly down the sides. I will say that I've sat outside once during the workday and service was very slow, however the next time we sat inside and were quickly attended to.

F5YILBLKTZ4tWjUR_ucY_g.text: My favorite place in southside.  Amazing food. Over the top friendly staff, especially kate the bartender. Never have a wait for drinks. Specials offered daily. Trivia night/$5 burger night on mondays are awesome.

665bbRXhox6mkAo-k27yKw.text: I eat at OTB frequently for lunch since I work nearby, it's in my rotation and it's most likely not changing.  The burgers are good, and I enjoy that I can get a beef or turkey burger as in Pittsburgh that's a rarity.    For lunch my biggest complaint is usually the time it takes to eat there, and it's a little overpriced.  It doesn't look like there is a lunch menu, so $9 for a lunch burger is a little steep.  If you want a side salad instead of fries (they do have good fries) it's $2 more, which is also a little expensive since there isn't anything special about the side salad.  Their soda also tastes a little grimy and flat usually, could probably clean the heads more often.   The beer selection looks great, but I don't partake really during lunch.

QBjDqRMPjMcSFOzzpCAWbw.text: Do not get me wrong, I like OTB, and not just because I live right across the street.  Decent food, nice eclectic crowd, lots of beers to choose from.... BUT their service can downright BLOW.  Even when they are not busy, it can be hard to get service.  Definitely not the most attentive servers and bartenders.  Since service is how I determine whether or not I truly like a place or not, I can only give this 1 star...

6sDLNjPM84p5muKqlbmE-Q.text: The atmosphere is cool. They have a full bar, but i did not partake.  I had the club sandwich. It had spinach instead of lettuce, which was new, but good. Both hostess and waitress were very friendly and attentive. A definate repeat if i'm ever in the area.

EiwCVKHp9ir1AduHZ-Ga_A.text: Go here on Mondays. All burgers are $5 - doesn't include fries - but the burgers are more than enough food. And Monday is trivia night. Usually Monday is trivia night.   Trivia starts between 8:30 and 9pm. They have lots of beer specials, a great draft list and they host many many community events here.

8-M7oBH6z21RK4rY_3rJTQ.text: I went to OTB for lunch yesterday.  When I asked for the beer menu I was told it was being "revised".  So the waitress asked me, what kind of beer do I like?  I told her I was looking for a red ale so she suggested Blue Moon.  It wasn't the option I was looking for but I do like Blue Moon and I ordered it. I ordered the pannini sandwich for lunch.  The buffalo mozzarella was thick and cold and the bread was soggy. I choose the coleslaw as a side and it was an ordinary slaw, nothing special.  The service was good and the food was okay.  What sealed the deal for a return trip was the location and beautiful sunny day.  On my return visit,  I'm skipping the meal and ordering an appetizer and a Blue Moon unless of course they have a red ale. ;-)

EHRSvU6_M2HENcTFfsBU9Q.text: I've been here a few times and I really like this place. There are a lot of items on the menu and most of them are quite unique.  Good selection of vegetarian options as well. We had the Black Bean cakes as an appetizer which were very good. I don't remember what my sandwich was called, but it was a veggie burger with spinach, roasted red peppers, tomato, and Sriracha-Ranch sauce.  Very tasty!    The service was good, although it wasn't very busy when we were there.   Overall, it's a very laid back place with great bar food.

7I6tQ-nZKPeawrD1nHHl9Q.text: Oh, Over the Bar, you beautiful bar, you. I honestly don't get to come here as often as I'd like.  They updated the menu and this/the taco tuesday night are what dropped my review a star and prompted me to write again. I still love the people working, they're friendly and spot on with the drinks and food. The interior is hip and fun and interesting to look at.   Sadly they took my favorite burger from the menu. The Beach Cruiser was a delicious concoction with pineapple and BBQ. So amazing and literally the only thing I would order. I felt a little crest-fallen when I realized it wasn't an option anymore, although The Thick is doing it's best at convincing me otherwise.  Another surprising disappointment was Taco Tuesday. While, admittedly my heart does belong to another when it comes to Tuesday night Taco party, I'm always willing to try another taco.   We had a rather large diverse group show up for the taco party and I ordered 3 soft tacos. One beef and two chicken. The shells were rather large, but dry and almost stale. The toppings were also dry and honestly didn't fill a third of the shell. Normally I would have let this go, except that they're one of the pricier options for Taco Tuesday at $1.00 a piece.  In all not terrible either way, but important updates none the less.

5ICdSg8ox3FDfsjIUI62EQ.text: The best bizarre menu in Pittsburgh. Try the banana seat hamburger. Lean ground beef, peanut butter, bacon and a banana. Trust me you can't go wrong. It is awesome and so delicious. Vegetarian options are available.

oVdMfd4sjpNluI14NeY0bA.text: I ordered out from OTB last night. It was hot and ready when I got there. The bar tender was busy yet still quick to make eye contact. The atmosphere is fun, creative and welcoming. Also the beer selection is really something. The food was so good. Burger cooked just right and fries were seasoned like no other. They're very thoughtful with to go packaging and included ketchup before I had to ask. I call this a BIG Win!

y-6HI8gjphffkVLI0tunag.text: Not a bad little place.  I've been here a few times and I enjoy the atmosphere and people watching.  I've had their famous peanut butter burger and honestly, I wanted more peanut butter!  I've seen pictures of gooey burgers and that's what I wanted.  Perhaps it was an off-night in the kitchen.  Their appetizers are great and their fries are awesome.  Barring the one time with the PB, I don't think you can go wrong with a meal and a drink here.  I also had the opportunity to sit at the bar during happy hour last night.  I don't mind sitting alone and scribbling away in a notebook or on a cocktail napkin if the mood strikes (I know, I'm a cliche).  Definitely get here early for a seat if you want to enjoy happy hour ($2 off drafts, 1/2 off appetizers).  The bartenders were friendly with the regulars but left me alone.  The girl who was there early on was more pleasant to me than the gentleman who relieved her, though.  It wasn't off-putting, so no strikes for that.  I'm teetering between 3 and 4 stars because it's an "a-ok" kind of place.  I'll go with 4 because over-all, I have few complaints and I like it well enough to keep coming back!

stFfd9BPgX7hWBW3DhJ13w.text: I love the seitan wings, their beer list is mouth-watering, and I've yet to have a bad server or bartender. I bring friends and family often, vegetarians and omnivores alike, and I've yet to have someone not enjoy their meal.  My only complaint is that their pierogies are definitely Mrs. T's. In a pierogie town like Pittsburgh, I can't condone selling 6 store-bought pierogies for $6.

U_qOKDFlQxzVI0qj0b087Q.text: I'm not a hipster, I own two bikes, but I'm hardly a cyclist, and I don't like PBR...but I do generally like OTB.  I love the overall atmosphere of OTB. The over-the-top cycling theme could've easily crossed the line into the cheesy theme bar territory, but it's nicely executed, and after about two steps into the place, you'll see why OTB seems to have staked their claim as the cycling community's primary hangout. Did you get a nail in your tire from riding through one of Carson Street's many construction zones? No worries...you can pick up a new tube at the bar while enjoying any number of good craft brews on tab or in bottles, then get your ride back up-and-running out front with the other regulars who might even help you out. It caters to the cycling community in every way, and I think it's great that a place like OTB exists in the Southside. Of course, we have other bike shops in the area, so I'll focus on the other stuff.  Service isn't great, but it's good enough. I always seem to have "someone new" waiting on me at the tables, but my meals usually come out fine. The bartenders are okay, as well. Sometimes it seems like service is a little slow, though. Also, while they OTB has a decent selection of bottled beer, the inventory always seems to be out when I get there... or it runs out while I'm there. Order two or three of any bottle, and there's a chance that you won't be able to order a fourth (you know...for those of us who can walk to the bar from our house...since we'd never have four drinks if we drove, right? Right? Never mind). The same goes for drafts. "Beer today, gone tomorrow..." might as well be one of their mottos.  The food is average, with some items turning out pretty decent, while others hit the jump fine, but rarely stick the landing. The seitan wings are often overcooked and tough, which is a downer because even though I'm not a vegetarian, I do enjoy some seitan wings from time to time. The sandwiches are all pretty decent, but there's really not much more to elaborate on because...well...there's nothing to truly rave about or hate on the menu. Therefore, if you're a cyclist looking to socialize with similar people, and you don't mind an average meal to fuel your next ride, it's the perfect place for you. For the rest of us, it's just a decent place to stop in for a quick meal and a decent beer.

0QZGLZNDDnTHDoud5_bing.text: A friend and I were the only two people in the bar when we ordered food and a beer - the service from the bartender, Keith, was atrocious. Keith, not only acted as we were inconveniencing him but had no desire to show enthusiasm towards our first visit. Also, attempting to show my support towards the biking community, I brought up the fact that I was a member of a local organization BikePgh, which he did not believe - unfortunately I did not have my membership card readily available. Upon requesting for our checks he was very blunt and had no desire to request our reviews on our meal or service.  On the other hand, the food was excellent and will attempt to make it back to OTB for the food - hopefully we will not have to interact with such unpleasant staff again.

0t5LoianAD7pD8YKhzBtUQ.text: Good food, cool atmosphere. Glad to see they did something cool with the boathouse in North Park! Got the cod sandwich and it was delicious and at an affordable price. This is a pretty cool stop if you're around the park and are looking for a place for a bite.

6oos_EuQl7YR0S-FfKpUKw.text: Solid. Pretty much our "go to" place on the Southside. Friendly staff and constantly good food. The beer selection is worthy and always changing.

Zb4C8HD3QQE00yGPrUfd2A.text: Don't you dare drive here. JUST KIDDING. Maybe. This place is adorable - the decor is basically TGIF but TGFB thank god for bikes, and you can sit under the imposing and awe-inspring shadow of a trike, or mountain bike, or classic road bike....take your pick, then listen for the sound of the bike bell a-dinging to alert waitresses when your food is ready! Did I mention bikes? Bikes bikes bikes. On my bike - I mean burger! - I had bacon added to an already-quirky combination of beef, fresh peanut butter, and blackberry preserves ("The Fixie"....of courrrrse). Delicious. The fries are way, way above average - like tall bike above average. Good, local beer selection on tap that changes pretty frequently. They brought out Penn Brewery's Chocolate Stout yesterday, and I had some today - awesome! I'd say more, but I can already see you grabbing your U-lock and heading out the door....  pee ess, bike safe :D

photos.caption: Photo of OTB Bicycle Café - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of OTB Bicycle Café - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. poop-a-thon!

zdNz7grw9BlfT_joB-OuYw.text: Prefect spot to set outside with the dog, the burgers were great cook just right had the one with peanut butter that was the first time for that on Monday they 6.99 and beer in the bottle was 2$

mYZvtiANcY81BNT4enZKiA.text: Delicious lunch today at OTB. Really cool environment with a no-nonsense staff. Their menu is full of special burger and sandwich treats all with fun bicycle themes. It's important to note that the burgers aren't limited to just ground meat, you can get turkey, chicken, etc; great! Order anything, you definitely can't go wrong here and their fries are so delicious! They also have an extensive beer list (sadly I couldn't partake since I had to go back to work after). Can't wait to get back here!

t8N6NkRlSzMSg2mPxTGYBw.text: My favorite place to eat in Pittsburgh! It's not just another Carson St. Gastropub- the menu is unique and creative and the beer list never disappoints. Get the Seitan wings even if you're not a veg. Great place for any type of food preference, including those that like to eat animals ;)

7uIFZTxfM-75lCTw-Fc1uw.text: I came here for lunch today with two friends and one small dog. Love that they allow dogs on the outside seating. I had an absolutely awesome burger, friend one had a Cobb salad, and friend to the shrimp tacos. Everything was really really good. One of the best burgers I've ever had. Only reason I didn't get this five stars is that the hummus appetizer was really awful!

xozrxlM77XDuszsMV1sYzQ.text: Awesome beer selection (limited draft choices), killer food, and awesome value. I will definitely be stopping back soon.

7kr1CF1ivkii6mCy_2QDhg.text: Otb has a great vibe!  This is a great change from most Pittsburgh bars, considering everything is usually basic and bland.    I had a burger with fries, cole slaw, egg and not sure all what else.  The burger was excellent, enjoyed it very much.    The beer selection is small, but had barrel aged tenfidy on tap while we were there.  So while small, they have some amazing stuff.    We sat at the bar on a Saturday night. The service was friendly and attentive, excellent.   I would say this is my favorite spot on Carson st.  Ride your bicycle.

6CWtx4OJr9OAdSGBKc3buQ.text: Love this place, my husband and I come to Pittsburgh a lot for business,  try to come here on every trip.  Decor and laid back, funky atmosphere,  great food with lots of healthy options !!

kSuLzLm-Ukcjt46iPlCGdg.text: The best buffalo chicken dip in south side. Hands down. The burgers and fries are also good. Haven't tried much outside of that. Simply because I'm hooked. Also nice drink specials at happy hour. Bartenders friendly as well as the crowd.

c0DDMUKP_QBQmsSDzQgzjg.text: I love the idea of a bicycle cafe and a business supporting being active and green.  Plus, reading the menu so many things sounded delicious that I was having trouble making my selection.   But that's where the good news ends.    The service was so slow.  We could never find our waitress and when she came to the back area where we had a table, it was hard to flag her down.   She didn't check on the table very often and really just came to the table to deliver drinks, take our order and bring our food.  As a result, we didn't even order more drinks.  At the end of the meal, we actually had to flag down another server and ask her to get our waitress.   I ordered the appetizer black bean cakes as my meal with a side of guac, sour cream and pico de gallo.  The cakes were good but they just weren't great. The guacamole was terrible.  There was no way it was homemade.    It was thin like ketchup rather than chunky and filled with tomatoes, cilantro, onions and jalapeno.   I also sampled a friend's fries.  They were good but a little too salty and could have been a little crisper.  I think their menu options are great but they need to improve the execution and quality of the cooking.   All in all, not a great experience but I still love the idea of this place and from what I hear they really support the cycling community and it's a great meet up or post-ride spot for cycling groups.

RiYe0g5RfpkeCh0aSQS58Q.text: Peanut butter on burgers? Oh my. But so delicious!  So if you're especially craving a burger but also want to try a pb&j with a twist, I suggest getting The Fixie. (they offer different types of patties, so vegetarians aren't left out) And if you like bananas, the Banana Seat is also a tasty choice. They even let you ask to have their yummy blackberry preserve added to the Banana Seat if you want a neat Fixie/Banana Seat hybrid.  But if you're not in the mood for a burger, my friend really enjoys the Bicycle Times BLT. It packs a lot of flavor with the egg and avocado combination.  All burgers and sandwiches come with fries that are nicely seasoned.  Also on Mondays, burgers are $5 and select appetizers are half-off. :D

jzXMCcS2vPK6s6sLW-almQ.text: More like 3.5 stars, and we will discuss why that is.  Showed up here for a trivia night with friends.  The atmosphere in here is great.  Everything feels so alive and vibrant.  Everyone laughing, having a good time.  Not a good thing when you come to battle royale in trivia.  Makes it hard to hear the questions being asked.  I think to make it more interesting, they should make you were earmuffs, just to up the difficulty.  Service wise they are amazing.  We sat down at the table to meet our friends and we didn't even have to get comfortable before a waitress was in front of us with menus and asking what we would like to drink.  When our drinks came back to the table I had a question about the menu and she was on point with the answer.  My decision was made.  Being that I just ate before coming here, I only opted for an appetizer.  I selected the fried pickles with a peanut butter dipping sauce.  It took a few minutes for it to be prepared.  Which was truly surprising to me.  Why?  Well let me tell you why.  When my pickles showed up, they looked..."normal."  I tried the peanut butter dipping sauce first to see how I would like it, it wasn't for me, so I asked for ranch instead.  I then proceeded to pick up my pickles with extra care, you know, they looked fresh out of the grease.  I didn't want to burn myself.  But that was a lie.  They were freezing cold in the middle...and crispy on the outside.  I mean how do you even do that?  Deep fry something and it still comes out partially frozen.  I thought I was imagining things until my friends confirmed it for me that they were indeed still cold.  When the waitress came back I informed her of this and said that I wasn't going to eat these.  Within moments the cook had another set of pickles in the fryer and this time they came out perfect.  So perfect I burnt the roof of my mouth because the anticipation was killing me.  I will give this place another chance, but probably during the early evening to try other items on the menu.  And maybe when it's not so crowded just yet.

Se6m14R7Od3LD3nyite8uA.text: Aye yie yie, I had to update this review because I didn't even mention their food before!   It's. so. good. GREAT burgers and fries. Oh, I love their fries. Had fish tacos at the new North Park location and they were really good, loved the pineapple salsa -- plus not too heavy.   Seriously, it's all so good. I love the pierogies, the salads, even the hummus is great!  It's just really good bar food, with a wide selection and cozy, comfy atmosphere. You don't have to be a bicycle enthusiast to want to come here!

eaCznthrpRi_ae68gKqVxg.text: I usually go to the one out in north park but my friend lives right next to here and we meet here all the time. Love the healthy choices

-EMV52oMPsCbeM-kbGHyPQ.text: Came here on a Monday night, around 6:00, for burger night, with a group of 8. There were only about 3 tables occupied when we entered but people filtered in and out. I ordered the Dirt Rag ($6) and a side of fries ($1). As a peanut butter fan, I loved the Dirt Rag!! I was a bit skeptical before ordering, but the sweet crunchy texture of the peanut butter won me over; the burger probably would have been even better if they added a few more pickles to offset the peanut butter. I also tried a bite of the fried pickle spears with ranch, but was not impressed, would skip this appetizer.  General consensus in our group was that the burgers are delicious but slightly overpriced, even with the discount for burgers night. The staff got off to a slow start in seating our large group but was friendly and attentive through the night. Bonus points for not adding gratuity even though we had a large group. Would return if in the area!

eE_k80E7S6HP1tO2WbFnIw.text: This is a biker bar through and through. Not the leather chap kind put the tight spandex wearing kind. To get them confused could be devastating to your dental health.   The bike bar is a pretty good bar, and the food is pretty good as well. They do something that will blow your mind with some of their burgers. They have burgers that have Wholey's peanut butter on them. Yeah peanut butter on a burger! It's really really good and compliments the beef very well. Don't knock it until you try it.   They have a good beer selection and the food is good. Give it a try.  Update 11/05/2012  The new burger "The Banana Seat" has bacon wrapped bananas, and peanut butter on a burgher. It was beyond delicious.

photos.caption: Photo of OTB Bicycle Café - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. This is a new burger. It&#39;s called &#34;the banana seat&#34; and its delicious. Banana wrapped in bacon with wholey&#39;s peanut butter. YUM

ax5v4dI5G8pZjQpdTwqRGw.text: Passed this place a bunch of times but never ventured in. Glad we finally decided to stop in.
